data: As per site policy / post fall algorithm
As per site policy / post fall algorithm

Modified NEXUS (National Emergency X-Radiography Utilization Study)
If patient meets all five criteria, an extrication collar and further diagnostic imaging is not warranted:
1. No midline tenderness - must have no pain on palpation of the spine
2. No focal neurological deficits - must have normal motor sensory exam
3. No altered Level of Conciousness - must be alert and oriented x 4
4. No intoxication - judgment and pain sensation must be intact
5. No major distracting injury - defined as a major traumatic injury that would interfere with ability to assess pain response to palpatation of the spine
C-spine injury cannot be ruled out
Unstable Spine, Maintain neutral spine alignment, Maintain cervical spine precautions with C-Spine collar, 3 person spinal turn, and slider board transfer
Unstable Spine, Maintain neutral spine alignment, Maintain thoracolumbar spine precautions, 2 person spinal turn, and slider board transfer
Other (please specifiy), Apply Rigid / Semi-Rigid collar as per site policy
Other (please specifiy), Collar/Brace on at all times (24/7), Rigid / Semi-Rigid collar as per site policy
Other (please specifiy), Collar/Brace on HOB > 30 and out of bed, Rigid / Semi-Rigid collar as per site policy
Other (please specifiy), Collar/Brace on HOB > 45 and out of bed, Rigid / Semi-Rigid collar as per site policy
Do not remove collar/brace while in radiology department
Consider consultation with neurosurgery, Spine, Trauma or Emergency
